         self.assertEqual(num_params(n), 3)

+    def test_call_supports_python_dict_output(self):
+        class Net(nn.Module):
+            def __init__(self):
+                super(Net, self).__init__()
+                self.l1 = l
+
+            def forward(self, inputs):
+                return {"output": self.l1(inputs)}
+
+        l = nn.Linear(10, 20)
+        net = Net()
+        data = Variable(torch.randn([5, 10]))
+        net(data)
body: My bad - I was thinking from an older version where this would have been run as the logic was outside the backward hook conditional, but it changed recently. Updated with a backward hook with just passes.
